title: Early Childhood Effects of Digital Games
headline: Learn how computer games can help or hinder childhood development in this free online child psychology course.
description: This child psychology course covers the effect of digital gaming on young minds. We discuss the impact of responsible digital parenting on early childhood development and show you to spot the signs of gaming addiction. This course is designed for parents and those engaged in childcare and provides the skills required to help children manage technological addiction. Sign up to help children reap the benefits of gaming without too much screen time!
courseDescription:
How does gaming addiction affect children? This childhood development course focuses on the growing problem of digital gaming addiction in young people. With the increasing popularity of video games and the widespread use of technology, it is crucial to understand the impact of excessive gaming on young children. This practical course covers various topics, including early childhood development, the role of family and communication as well as the parenting of these ‘digital natives’.

What does too much gaming do to a child? We describe the dangers of excessive gaming and offer ways in which parents or educators can help children avoid these. This course also provides practical tips to let you predict gaming addiction. We provide expert insights to keep you up to date with the latest research on gaming addiction and its effects on growing minds. We explain how psychological and social factors contribute to excessive gaming and lay out the factors that drive the move from ‘hobby’ to ‘addiction’.

Computer games can also provide positive stimuli to children so our final section goes over the advantages and disadvantages of digital games to help you understand how to embrace technology responsibly. This practical course is designed for parents, babysitters, teachers, psychologists, childhood specialists, school counsellors or paediatricians. Our video lectures provide a comprehensive understanding of the issue and equip you with the skills and knowledge you need to address digital gaming addiction in children. Sign up to join a community of parents and professionals committed to promoting healthy digital habits in children. Games offer children rich opportunities for learning and entertainment but you may be concerned that your child is getting too attached to their screens. If so, this course is for you.
